Here's a little peek behind the scenes of a virtual learning classroom and what teachers do to make the magic happen. In this photo, two Dalraida Elementary fifth-grade math teachers, Donna Miller and Lashonda Haigler, work together to meet their students' virtual learning needs.

Haigler is monitoring the Zoom meeting to ensure students are entering, staying muted when necessary, staying on task and more. Meanwhile, Miller is teaching the math lesson. Look closer and you'll see that there is a second camera recording the lesson for YouTube! That way, they can upload the lesson for anybody who needs to go back and watch it again.

These dedicated teachers and others do this every morning to ensure students continue to receive a quality education!

Starting this month, Montgomery Public Schools students who qualify for free and reduced lunch will receive Wi-Fi vouchers to assist with internet connectivity for distance learning.

The program, Alabama Broadband Connectivity (ABC), will provide the Wi-Fi vouchers. The vouchers will help cover equipment and service costs for high-speed internet service from the fall through Dec. 30, 2020.

Although MPS provides all of its students with free lunches, only families with children who qualify for free or reduced school lunch will be notified via a mailed letter in August. Parents are strongly encouraged to update their contact information. The program is expected to run August through Dec. 30, 2020, in accordance with CARES Act guidelines. For more information, please visit https://abcstudents.org.

Congratulations to the Macmillan International Academy kindergarten graduates! The kindergarten team at MacMillan wanted to celebrate their students' accomplishments while following social distancing guidelines. So they threw a Promotional Parade!

Parents decorated cars and loved ones watched and cheered in the parking lot as students drove by. Coach Ray played music and Principal Faith Goshay used a loudspeaker to announce each student as they drove by. Students received their promotional certificate as well as gifts of trophies, picture magnets and souvenir cups handed to them through the window of their car. The theme was simple: Our year was cut short but our dreams were not!

This kindergarten class certainly made history, and their teachers Chrisanthia Glass, Trinecia Powers, and Shanda Williams wanted to let their students know just how much they've meant to them this year and how much they will never forget the kindergarten class of 2020!

U.S. News and World Report ranks schools based on several criteria, including college readiness, underserved student performance and graduation rates.

As MPS continues to provide meals for students while schools are closed, it's so gratifying to see heartwarming stories like this one that was shared by one of our parents. (For more information about the meals program, click here: https://bit.ly/2UyNI48)

"She bounced out of bed this morning to remind me she saw the sign at Wares Ferry Elementary about breakfast and lunch pick up. I told her we should probably not use it until we need it because times are gonna get rough, she convinced me that the breakfast from school was much better than the bowl of cereal I had already offered, so off we went (because, well the princess rules).. we were warmly greeted with a, "Good morning!! How are you doing??" By the security officer and we could see the principal keeping busy and keeping organized behind him, he brought us her breakfast and told us to be sure and come back for lunch from 11-1 because it was Quesadilla Day!
With everything going on around us, it was a nice to be greeted with a smile and reminded to come back!
Thank you MPS for offering this to our kiddos. ❤"

Congratulations to Carver Elementary and Arts Magnet parent liaison Connell "C.J." Vandiver and YMCA of Greater Montgomery VP of Community Development Darryl Woods for winning the BellXcell 2019 Educator of the Year award! They were chosen for the work with Power Scholar Academy summer learning program. BellXcell chose to highlight this program out of 150 programs across the United States!

The PSA is run in partnership by MPS and the YMCA. BellXcell, a national educational nonprofit, applauded the program's measurable success. Over 100 third-grade students gained an average of two months of reading skills and three months of math skills through the program, BellXcell reports.

Also, 100 percent of teachers reported an increase in the students’ confidence, while 94 percent of parents reported their child having a more positive attitude about school, according to BellXcell.

Pictured from left are MPS Chief Academic Officer Bernard Mitchell; Darryl Woods; BellXcell CEO Lauren Sanchez Gilbert; Connell VanDiver; and Gary A. Cobbs, President/CEO of the YMCA of Greater Montgomery.

Students from Brewbaker Technology Magnet High School’s Engineering Academy recently participated in a technical challenge called Project Flash presented by the Air Force team at MGMWERX.

Team members Brett Tolerson, Julia Fromm, James Beaulieu, Robert Parker and Troy Morgan constructed two prototypes of expendable packing for a Raspberry Pi that could accomplish a number of goals. The systems could survive from an altitude of 10,000 feet, not block Wi-Fi signals, and allow access to the micro USB ports and the micro SD card slot on the Raspberry Pi without removing it from the packaging.

Pictured: BrewTech student Julia Fromm receives a team recognition letter from Air Force Brig.-Gen. Jeremy T. Sloan.

Congratulations to BrewTech, the first school in the River Region to earn STEM certification under accreditation agency Cognia's new standards!
